remarks: If the degree of a univariate polynomial is less than some index, then that coefficient must be zero.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 23-Mar-2015.)
statement:
deg1leb.d $e |- D = ( deg1 ` R ) $.
deg1leb.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
deg1leb.b $e |- B = ( Base ` P ) $.
deg1leb.y $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
deg1leb.a $e |- A = ( coe1 ` F ) $.
deg1lt $p |- ( ( F e. B /\ G e. NN0 /\ ( D ` F ) < G ) -> ( A ` G ) = .0. ) $.
